result.execSummary:
The defendant Jessica L Peterson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Receiving Stolen Property (<=$2500) AMENDED FROM Theft-Movable Property >$2500-$5000, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.34(1)(a).
  • Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court
Racine County Clerk of Circuit Court

miscConds.notes: Defendant is ordered to pay restitution during the pendancy of probation.  Restitution is joint and several with co-defendant.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.
Obtain and maintain full time verifiable employment.  Defendant may not work in an establishment that serves alcohol.
No alcohol, random UA's at discretion of agent.

No controlled substances, random UA's at discretion of agent.  Do not associate with any known drug dealers or users.  Defendant may only take medication pursuant to a prescription.  Defendant is not to have any addictive substances of any kind, even with a prescription.  Defendant is to sign medical release to allow agent access to medical and prescription records.  Agent is to approve all prescriptions.
Counseling, treatment, services as deemed appropriate by agent. Defendant must obey all rules and regulations of probation.

Defendant must pay all outstanding fees and court obligations.  If supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: With Huber for work. DO NOT REPORT LATE OR UNDER THE INFLUENCE OF ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY REQUIRED.

Defense req bond mod to remove GPS.
State objects.
BTC:  Bond mod granted - remove GPS condition of bond. Add no alc/cs - ZCI to monitor.
  Status conference scheduled for November 10, 2014 at 09:00 am.  Final pre-trial scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 08:15 am.  Jury trial scheduled for February 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Charges per attached criminal complaint. Conditions:  ***ALSO $1,000.00 SIGNATURE BOND***  No contact with the victim (person, property, residence or family).  No contact with the co-defendants.   Defendant to be placed on GPS monitor through Zimmerman Consulting Inc. (ZCI), 524 Main Street, 3rd floor, (262-632-1780). Exceptions are going to court, meeting with atty, going to school and going to work, only if defendant tells employer of theft charges.   Failure to appear will result in the issuance of a warrant for your arrest, possible bail jumping charges and forfeiture of any bond on deposit.

**AMENDED 05-07-2014 DEFENDANT MAY ATTEND A DOCTOR'S APPOINTMENT ON MAY 9, 2014 BETWEEN THE HOURS OF 2 PM AND 4 PM**

**AMENDED  05-16-2014 - DEFENDANT MAY ATTEND DOCTOR'S APPOINTMENTS AND SCHOOL AS LONG AS PROOF IS PROVIDED TO ZCI AND ALL DATES, TIMES AND LOCATIONS ARE APPROVED PRIOR TO TRAVEL TO EACH. DEFENDANT MAY ALSO ATTEND HER SISTER'S CONFIRMATION ON MAY 18, 2014 AT FIRST EVANGELICAL LUTHERAN CHURCH AT 728 VILLA STREET, RACINE, WI 53403 BETWEEN THE HOURS OF 9:00 AM AND 2:00 PM**

**AMENDED 09-15-2014 - GPS MONITORING IS REMOVED.  NO ALCOHOL OR CONTROLLED SUBSTANCES EVEN WITH A PRESCRIPTION.  ZCI TO MONITOR WITH RANDOM UA'S**
ZCI

Defendant Jessica L Peterson in court with attorney Helmi Hamad.  Noah Wishau appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court Reporter: Kim Slaasted.
Defense files a motion to review bond. Defense asks that the Court modify bond to remove GPS. The State objects to modification of bond. Deft was on bond in Misd case prior to this incident and the basis of this case is that deft was employed as a babysitter when this crime ocurred. Restitution is in the excess of $25,000.00. The State indicates that the victim's are present in court.

BTC: There are no changes in circumstance and therefore, bond modification is denied.  Status conference scheduled for September 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.
ZCI
